title: Pleased so far...
comment: I installed to my nexus 4, set up some sample website logins, tried backup and it does back up to internal storage even though my device does not have sd card capability.  I set up sync to dropbox and works fine.  I then tried installing desktop version to pc and had trouble accessing dropbox, getting invalid master pasword as some have mentioned.  Found out I was doing it wrong.  I was using the pc option to Open database from url and supplying dropbox info for access to the upm.db file on dropbox.  Then I realized I had to install dropbox on the pc and let dropbox sync with my pc/android device.  Then on pc version chose Open database and point to the dropbox folder on my pc and the upm.db file there.  I even tried the Export file option to create a csv text file and that worked fine.  The  Open database from url option is for acessing a db you may have on your own server.  So I am very pleased so far - just like to see a better icon for the app (low quality so blurry)  Grouping option (though not that important), and google drive sync option.  Kudos to the developer!

title: Perfect
comment: Update.  I'm somewhat of an idiot - I complained that this app didn't "copy" the password and that I had to edit the password, select it, and then copy.  I was wrong.  If you tap and hold for a second (on Android) on the account in question, the option comes up to copy the username or password to the clipboard.  On the PC version there are buttons to do this.  Overall, this app, while used with Dropbox, is awesome and I couldn't be more pleased with it.   Original review (I'm an idiot):  Syncs up great via dropbox with my two android devices and my PC.  My only complaint is the lack of 'copy' action for the password on the android devices.  For example, if I need a password to a website on my android device, I pull up UPM and look up the password.  It would be nice, if while looking up the password, I could just copy it to the clipboard to paste it in the web page.  As it is now, I have to 'edit' the password so I can highlight and copy.  A little copy button would make this app perfect!  The PC version also doesn't have the copy option but I can just highlight it and hit ctrl-c.  And the android version you can't even highlight it unless you are in edit mode.

title: So secure not even I can get in!
comment: Best way to protect information is to not let the user get to it. I strongly suggest you get this if you want to be extra secure. Do you know what I do when I go out the house? I lock up my doors and then throw my key into the gutter for the water to wash it down to the drain. When I get home I go "oh wow this place is so locked up and secure" and sleep outside because I can't get in. What can I say? I'm paranoid, and boy do my methods work. I once got to work 30 minutes late and I saw my boss waiting outside the door because he couldn't get in. I said "yeah I changed the keycode on the door because I was scared people could read my mind to get the code and come in to touch our things" then he asked what the code is and I said "well I typed it in without looking. I didn't want to remember it because I was scared people could read my mind to get the code and come in to touch our things. I just said that, I don't think you're paying attention". He then fired me on the spot, but that's okay, I don't have to exit my house now. I also swallowed my key and locked the house from the inside.

title: Very good, minor bugs
comment: This app is simple and brilliant. Keeps your passwords safe, exactly what it should do, and nothing more.  There are features I could use, and a bug that annoys me. A feature I miss qould be a quick (context menu?) way to copy a password (since my passwords are horrible to remember, hence this app). Generating passwords would also be a good feature, but many apps to do this are already available.  A bug I keep running into: When I launch the app sometimes (I know how awful that sounds to a developer) the application "hangs". I only see the UPM title bar and a black screen. Closing and relaunching works, but needs two or three tries sometimes. I do not know what's causing it, and I've sent an error report already. I hope the developer can fix it :).
